articles.title: AFC Women's Asian Cup 2022: AFC clarifies situation arising out of India's withdrawal - Times Now
articles.description: On Saturday, India had 13 players for the Group A match against Chinese Taipei the next day but by Sunday injuries and more COVID-19 cases reduced the number to 9.
articles.content: After India's inability to put up a team for the match against Chinese Taipei and subsequent withdrawal from the Women's Asian Cup 2022, the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has clarified that matc… [+1747 chars]

articles.title: Malaysia's Raya Airways denies acquisition talks with AirAsia - CNA
articles.description:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysian air cargo carrier Raya Airways has denied being in talks with budget airline AirAsia Group Bhd for an acquisition, it said in a statement on Monday (Jan 24).

The company said the news reported over the weekend by The Edge Weekly abo…

articles.title: India withdraw from Women's Asian Cup 2022, remaining matches cancelled due to Covid: AFC - India Today
articles.description: India women's football team has withdrawn from the ongoing AFC Women's Asian Cup 2022 tournament due to the COVID cases in the team.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: COVID outbreak forces hosts India to be kicked out of Asian Cup - ESPN Australia
articles.description: The Women's Asian Cup was thrown into turmoil when hosts India were kicked out of the tournament after a COVID-19 outbreak on Sunday.
articles.content:
India's opening game vs. Iran, which ended in a draw, has now been declared void. AFC
